content_chunks.title: Personal Information
content_chunks.content: My name is Jan Cornelius Miguel Alcaide. I am a Certified MCF AI-900 from Cagayan, Philippines. I am a student pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Artificial Intelligence who enjoys building machine learning models and AI-driven applications. You can reach me at janalcaide@spup.edu.ph or connect with me on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/jan-cornelius-miguel-alcaide-619a07393/ or GitHub at https://github.com/janalcaide-ops

content_chunks.title: AI & Machine Learning Skills
content_chunks.content: I have hands-on experience building machine learning models, data preprocessing pipelines, and prototype deployments. My AI work focuses on supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning (CNNs, RNNs/transformers), natural language processing, and computer vision. I primarily use Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, and Pandas.

content_chunks.title: Graphic Design & Creativity
content_chunks.content: I have Advanced proficiency in graphic design with specialization in Poster Design, Branding, Visual Communication, and Layout Design. I create creative posters and visual content. I use design tools including Figma, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and Canva.

content_chunks.title: Video Editing Skills
content_chunks.content: I have beginner-level experience in video editing. I am comfortable with Basic Video Editing, Transitions, and Color Grading. I have worked with tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, and CapCut. I am continuously improving my video editing skills through practice.

content_chunks.title: Education
content_chunks.content: I am studying at Saint Paul University Philippines Tugegarao City, pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. My relevant coursework includes Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Science, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Algorithms, Statistics for AI, and Model Deployment. I hold the MCF AI-900 certification and additional AI coursework certificates.

content_chunks.title: Language Learning AI Platform with Machine Learning
content_chunks.content: I developed a Language Learning AI Platform, an intelligent system that uses machine learning algorithms for personalized language learning recommendations. This platform implements NLP techniques for language processing, ML models for student performance prediction, and data analytics for adaptive learning paths. I used Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, and scikit-learn for AI implementation.

content_chunks.title: Predictive Analytics System for Student Performance
content_chunks.content: I built a Predictive Analytics System using machine learning to forecast student academic performance and identify at-risk students. This system implements supervised learning models for prediction, feature engineering for student data, and data visualization for actionable insights. Key features include ML-based performance prediction, clustering algorithms for student segmentation, and anomaly detection. Technologies used: Python, scikit-learn, Pandas, TensorFlow, and data analytics pipelines.

content_chunks.title: AI-Powered Digital Twin Workshop Platform
content_chunks.content: I am working on an AI-Powered Digital Twin Workshop Platform, an end-to-end RAG system for interview preparation and professional development. This platform helps professionals improve interview performance and career readiness. Technologies include Python, Upstash Vector, Groq API, and Next.js.

content_chunks.title: Career Goals and Learning
content_chunks.content: My short-term goal is to strengthen my skills in machine learning and deep learning, focusing on advanced model architectures, transfer learning, and optimization techniques. Long-term, I aspire to become a lead AI/ML engineer or AI research specialist in an innovative AI company working on cutting-edge problems. I am focused on learning advanced deep learning frameworks, large language models (LLMs), reinforcement learning, and model deployment in production. I am interested in industries like AI research, machine learning engineering, computer vision, and natural language processing. My recent learning includes transformer models, neural architecture design, hyperparameter optimization, and MLOps best practices.

content_chunks.title: Interview Preparation - Technical Skills
content_chunks.content: My technical expertise includes machine learning model development, deep learning architectures, natural language processing, and computer vision. I understand how to structure datasets, implement supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, perform feature engineering, normalize data, and optimize model performance. I can build CNN and RNN architectures, implement transfer learning, evaluate models with proper metrics, and deploy models in production environments using Python, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.

content_chunks.title: Interview Preparation - Problem Solving
content_chunks.content: When facing technical problems, I take a systematic approach: I immediately assess impact and severity, reproduce the issue in a safe environment, trace the code to find the root cause, implement a quick fix or workaround, test thoroughly, deploy the fix, monitor for recurring issues, and document the solution. I also use iterative development with regular stakeholder check-ins and break down requirements into smaller deliverables prioritized by business value.

content_chunks.title: Key Strengths and Attributes
content_chunks.content: My key strengths include strong machine learning and deep learning expertise with AI-900 certification, creative problem-solving in building intelligent systems, data preprocessing and feature engineering skills, quick learning ability to pick up new AI frameworks and techniques, and passion for solving complex problems using AI. I have practical experience building ML models, implementing neural networks, optimizing hyperparameters, and creating data-driven AI solutions that solve real-world problems.

behavioral.question: Tell me about a time you had to lead a difficult technical decision
behavioral.answer: When developing the Language Learning AI application, I had to decide between building a custom solution or using an existing framework. I chose to build custom HTML/CSS interfaces to ensure full control over the design and user experience. This decision allowed us to create a more intuitive dashboard for data analytics, improving adoption among stakeholders.

behavioral.question: Describe a project where you had to learn a new technology quickly
behavioral.answer: With the Language Learning AI application project, I needed to quickly learn data analytics and reporting tools to implement the analytics features. I learned through online resources, documentation, and practical implementation, successfully delivering a working analytics dashboard within the project timeline.

behavioral.question: How do you handle conflicting priorities and tight deadlines?
behavioral.answer: I prioritize based on impact and urgency. For the Student-Management-System and Scholarship Monitoring System, I broke down features into manageable sprints, focused on core functionality first, and used agile principles to adapt as requirements changed. Clear communication with stakeholders helped manage expectations.

technical.question: Explain your machine learning model development process
technical.answer: I start with understanding the problem and collecting relevant data. Then I perform exploratory data analysis, implement data preprocessing and feature engineering, select appropriate algorithms, train models with hyperparameter tuning, and evaluate using proper metrics. For my predictive analytics projects, I focused on model accuracy and interpretability. I implement cross-validation and optimize for production deployment.

technical.question: How would you approach building a machine learning solution?
technical.answer: Based on my AI projects, I would: (1) Define clear business objectives, (2) Collect and preprocess relevant data, (3) Perform feature engineering and selection, (4) Train multiple models and compare performance, (5) Implement hyperparameter optimization, (6) Evaluate with proper metrics and cross-validation, and (7) Deploy with monitoring for model performance.

technical.question: Describe your experience with data preprocessing and feature engineering
technical.answer: I have practical experience in data pipelines for ML projects. I understand how to handle missing values, normalize features, encode categorical variables, and perform feature scaling. I'm experienced with handling imbalanced datasets, creating meaningful features from raw data, and optimizing data pipelines for model training efficiency.

situational.question: A trained model is underperforming in production. Walk me through your response
situational.answer: I would: (1) Immediately assess the impact and severity of the performance drop, (2) Analyze model predictions on test data, (3) Check for data distribution shift or data quality issues, (4) Review preprocessing and feature engineering steps, (5) Retrain with updated data if needed, (6) Compare with alternative models, (7) Deploy the improved model, (8) Monitor performance metrics, and (9) Document the issues and solutions.

situational.question: How would you approach a project where model requirements keep changing?
situational.answer: I would use agile methodology with regular stakeholder check-ins. I'd break down the project into sprints, prioritize by impact and business value, and maintain flexible model pipelines. For my AI projects, changing requirements led me to build modular architectures that could adapt models and reuse components without major rewrites.

situational.question: Describe how you would evaluate and implement a new ML framework or technology
situational.answer: I would: (1) Research the framework thoroughly and compare with alternatives, (2) Consider the learning curve and team expertise, (3) Prototype with a small POC project, (4) Measure performance improvements and ease of use, (5) Create documentation and training materials, and (6) Plan rollout strategy. For frameworks like JAX or newer models, I would pilot with non-critical projects first.

weakness_mitigation.mitigation: While my primary focus has been model development and research, I'm actively learning MLOps and deployment technologies. Currently exploring Docker, FastAPI, and cloud platforms to expand my full-stack ML capabilities.

weakness_mitigation.weakness: Limited experience with advanced NLP architectures
weakness_mitigation.mitigation: While I have solid foundations in NLP, I'm actively deepening my expertise in transformers and large language models. Currently studying BERT, GPT architectures, and fine-tuning techniques for production systems.
